name: Robyn's 150th Quiz: From Albuquerque to Zincky | Humanities | 25 Questions

questions.explanation:
anarchy.

	Or Albuquerque or autarky (national economic self-sufficiency).

questions.text: Stubborn, as in a _______ horse that stops short and refuses to proceed?
questions.explanation:
balky & baulky.

	Or Binky.

chunky.

	Or clunky, cranky, colloquy, or Coquille St. Jacques (a French dish made with scallops) or Cokie Roberts, TV newscaster.

dinky.

	Or donkey or dinkey (a small locomotive).

exequy.

	An exarchy was a province in the Byzantine Empire. A eparchy is a district of modern Greece. Endarchy is the condition of forming from the center outward.

flunky & flunkey.

	Or funky, flaky, finicky, or Frankie (Johnnie's lover).

gawky & geeky.

	Or gunky, geeky, gimmicky, or gynarchy (government by women).

questions.text: A mark resulting from a love bite?
questions.explanation:
hicky & hickey.

	Or hinky, hunky, hooky, hockey, hanky, hulky, or hummocky.

inky.

	Or icky.

junkie.

	Or junky, jokey, Jacqui, or Jackie Kennedy.

kinky.

	Or kolacky (a type of pastry).

questions.text: TWO WORDS INSTEAD OF ONE THIS TIME: A tall, thin, gangly servant?
questions.explanation:
lanky lackey & lanky lacky.

	Or lucky, leaky, laky (blood colored), larky (playful), or Lakey (aka Elinor Eastlake, a character in Mary McCarthy's novel "The Group").

malarky & malarkey.

	Or monkey, mucky, murky, milky, minke (a small whale), monarchy, matriarchy, Mickey Mouse, or Marky Mark.

nooky.

	Or narky (irritable), Nickie, Nicky, Nikki, or Nanky Poo (a wandering minstrel in Gilbert and Sullivan's "Mikado").

questions.text: A government run by a few people?
questions.explanation:
oligarchy.

	Or Okie (a hick from Oklahoma or thereabouts). If you can think of any more, let me know!

patriarchy.

	Or picky, punky, pokey, panicky, or pawky (sly).

quirky.

	Or quickie.

risky.

	Or rinky dink.

questions.text: Elegant, chic, ostentatious, or showy: a _______ restaurant?
questions.explanation:
swanky.

	Or slinky, sulky, stinky, soliloquy, or Sukey (a pioneer girl's name--I guess it's short for Susan).

questions.text: A prison worker with the power to lock and unlock cell doors?
questions.explanation:
turnkey.

	Or turkey, talkie (a movie with sound), Hostess Twinkie, or twanky (a kind of green tea).

unlucky.

	Can't think of any more.

Vickie & Vicky.

	Can you think of any more? I can't.

wacky & whacky.

	Or whiskey, Wee Willie Winkie, walkie talkie, whelky (pimply), or wonky (unsteady or perhaps overly intellectual).

questions.text: I'm skipping X. During the American Civil War, a federal soldier?
questions.explanation:
Yankee.

	Or yolky or yucky. I heard that the origin of "Yankee" was "Jan (pronounced Yawn) Cheese," a derogatory term for New Yorkers of Dutch ancestry.

zincy & zincky.

	Or Zacky Farms turkey.
